Sure, here's a sample business plan for a treasury team at an asset manager:

Executive Summary:
Our firm is proposing to establish a dedicated treasury team to manage the cash and liquidity of our portfolios. This team will be responsible for optimizing returns on cash holdings, managing liquidity and cash flows, and overseeing collateral management. By establishing a dedicated treasury team, we can better manage risk and optimize returns across our equity funds.

Market Opportunity:
The asset management industry is highly competitive, and firms must be able to manage cash and liquidity effectively to compete. The regulatory environment has become more stringent in recent years, with requirements around capital adequacy, liquidity, and margining. The treasury team can help our firm meet these requirements and enhance our competitive position by managing risk more effectively and optimizing returns.

Product Offering:
Our treasury team will provide the following services:

* Cash management: managing cash balances, cash inflows and outflows, and short-term investments.
* Collateral management: selecting, optimizing, monitoring, and reporting on collateral to support derivatives transactions and financing arrangements.
* Risk management: monitoring and managing risk associated with cash and short-term investments, derivatives, and counterparty exposure.
* Trade execution: executing trades on behalf of the funds to purchase or sell securities, taking into account the funds' investment objectives and strategies.

Marketing Strategy:
We will market our treasury team to both existing and prospective clients, emphasizing our ability to optimize returns and manage risk. We will highlight our expertise in cash and liquidity management and our ability to manage collateral effectively. We will also promote our ability to meet regulatory requirements and provide customized solutions to our clients' cash management needs.

Management Team:
Our treasury team will be led by a seasoned professional with expertise in cash and liquidity management, collateral management, and risk management. The team will also include subject matter experts in each of these areas, as well as experienced traders and operations professionals.

Financial Projections:
We project that the treasury team will generate significant cost savings and revenue benefits for our firm. By optimizing returns on cash holdings and managing collateral more effectively, we estimate that the team will generate incremental revenue of $5 million per year. Additionally, we estimate that the team will reduce our operating costs by $3 million per year through more efficient cash management and collateral optimization.

Data and Analytics:
The treasury team will rely on a range of data sources and analytics to support its operations. This will include portfolio data, cash management data, derivatives data, regulatory data, market data, and counterparty data. The team will leverage this data to optimize cash and liquidity management, manage risk, and enhance collateral optimization.

Conclusion:
By establishing a dedicated treasury team, our firm can better manage cash and liquidity, optimize returns, and enhance our competitive position. We believe that the team will generate significant cost savings and revenue benefits and enable us to provide better solutions to our clients' cash management needs.
